
% AISentry Evaluation Results - LaTeX Tables
% Generated for research paper

% Table 1: Detection Method Comparison (Synthetic Benchmark)
\begin{table}[h]
\centering
\caption{Detection Method Performance on Synthetic Benchmark (40 files, 30 vulnerable)}
\label{tab:detection-comparison}
\begin{tabular}{lcccccc}
\toprule
Method & Precision & Recall & F1 & Critical Recall & TP & FP \\
\midrule
Pattern-Only & 0.857 & 1.000 & 0.923 & 1.000 & 30 & 5 \\
ML-Only & 0.857 & 1.000 & 0.923 & 1.000 & 30 & 5 \\
Taint-Only & 0.857 & 1.000 & 0.923 & 1.000 & 30 & 5 \\
Ensemble & 0.857 & 1.000 & 0.923 & 1.000 & 30 & 5 \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{table}

% Table 1b: Real-World Evaluation (LangChain)
\begin{table}[h]
\centering
\caption{Detection Results on Real-World LLM Project (LangChain, 1579 Python files)}
\label{tab:langchain-results}
\begin{tabular}{lcccccc}
\toprule
Method & Findings & Critical & High & Medium & Time (s) & ms/file \\
\midrule
Pattern-Only & 149 & 69 & 36 & 16 & 10.46 & 6.6 \\
ML-Only & 368 & 258 & 36 & 46 & 13.18 & 8.3 \\
Taint-Only & 149 & 69 & 36 & 16 & 10.64 & 6.7 \\
Ensemble & 368 & 258 & 36 & 46 & 13.17 & 8.3 \\
\midrule
\multicolumn{7}{l}{\textit{ML detection: +147\% findings with only +26\% overhead}} \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{table}

% Table 2: ML Model Training Results
\begin{table}[h]
\centering
\caption{ML Classifier Training Results (LightGBM, 5000 synthetic samples)}
\label{tab:ml-training}
\begin{tabular}{lcccc}
\toprule
Classifier & Precision & Recall & F1 & ROC-AUC \\
\midrule
Vulnerability (Binary) & 1.000 & 1.000 & 1.000 & 1.000 \\
Attack Type (Multi-class) & 1.000 & 1.000 & 1.000 & -- \\
\midrule
\multicolumn{5}{l}{\textit{5-fold Cross-Validation: F1 = 1.000 $\pm$ 0.000}} \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{table}

% Table 3: Feature Importance (Top 10)
\begin{table}[h]
\centering
\caption{Top Feature Importance for Vulnerability Classification}
\label{tab:feature-importance}
\begin{tabular}{lc}
\toprule
Feature & Importance \\
\midrule
llm\_call\_count & 121.0 \\
variable\_reuse\_count & 111.0 \\
has\_input\_call & 109.0 \\
llm\_output\_to\_sink & 101.0 \\
cross\_function\_flow & 100.0 \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{table}

% Table 4: Detection by Attack Vector
\begin{table}[h]
\centering
\caption{Detection Rate by Attack Vector Type}
\label{tab:attack-vectors}
\begin{tabular}{lccc}
\toprule
Attack Vector & Samples & Detected & Detection Rate \\
\midrule
Direct & 10 & 10 & 100.0\% \\
Indirect & 10 & 10 & 100.0\% \\
Stored & 10 & 10 & 100.0\% \\
\midrule
Safe (FP) & 10 & 5 & 50.0\% (FP Rate) \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{table}

% Table 5: Semantic Taint Influence Decay Parameters
\begin{table}[h]
\centering
\caption{Semantic Taint Influence Decay Parameters}
\label{tab:taint-params}
\begin{tabular}{lcc}
\toprule
Input Position & Influence Factor ($\alpha$) & Description \\
\midrule
Prompt (user message) & 0.85 & Direct influence on output \\
Context (history) & 0.70 & Moderate influence \\
System prompt & 0.50 & Indirect influence \\
Multi-hop ($n$ LLM calls) & $0.9^n$ & Exponential decay \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{table}
